p: Conradina is a reservoir of several important bioactive molecules. However, the chemical studies on Conradina are very limited in number. Six compounds were separated from the chloroform extract of C. canescens leaves ( Figure 3): ursolic acid, betulin, Î²-amyrin, myrtenic acid, n-tetracosane, and oleanolic acid [ 36]. C. canescens leaves are considered a natural source for ursolic acid [ 37].
